title: Home
text:
Welcome to our games website!
This is a selection of games curated at the Centre for Creative Learning, IIT Gandhinagar. These games can be recreated with easily available material and you will find rules, videos and boards to play them here. :-)

What kind of game are you looking for? Let us pick one for you! Or Answer these questions for a more customized selection!





  
  How much time do you have?
  
    Any amount of time
    <= 10 mins
    10-20 mins
    20-30 mins
    30-40 mins
  
  
  
  How many players?
  
    Any number of players
    Solo
    2 Players
    Between 3 and 10
    10 and more
  
  
  
  
  What difficulty?
  
    Any difficulty
    Easy
    Medium
    Hard
  
  
  
      Submit
      
  

  
    Suggestions
    
  
  
    Pick random from these

title: About Our Games
text:
About Our Games
This collection of games for the classroom has been curated for a variety of situations. In order to use these in the classroom you will usually need pens, paper and dice. Some games have custom cards or game boards â€“ black and white versions can be downloaded here.




Types of Games
Most games have simple rules. The games are split into games that can be used in the mathematics, SEL (Social and Emotional Learning), science classroom as well as some strategy games that give you alternatives to chess and checkers.

Mathematics and Probability
Language and Social
Strategy
Science and Deduction





Complexity
We enjoy playing even the simplest of these so a low complexity game is not just for primary school. However here is a rough correlation between age and complexity.
â˜… Â Â Â Â  Suitable for younger players, for class 3 (8 and above)
â˜…â˜… Â Â Â Â  Intermediate complexity, for class 6 (11 and above)
â˜…â˜…â˜… Â Â Â Â  More challenging games, for class 9 (14 and above)





Player Counts
We have games for different player counts.
Solo: Â Â Â  These are games (or puzzles) for 1 player.
2 players: Â Â Â  These are mostly strategy games and support exactly 2 players
Between 3 and 10: Â Â Â  These games can be played with more than 2 but less than 10 players.
10 and more: Â Â Â  Games for 10 or more! These can be played simultaneously by an entire class.
